Ian Badcoe wrote:
> 
> One aspect to iterative propagation that I didn't see mentioned yet
> is the question of variable time-delays on different paths through a 
> network.

Hi Ian,

Thanks for bringing this up.  I find it very interesting, especially 
since I come from a non-research background.  It all seems to come down 
to, as Ken Says, semantics.

In one system, you're more closely modeling (what we understand to be) 
biological systems; whereas, in another you sacrifice the biological 
accuracy for computing efficiency.

In either case, I believe you can solve the same set of problems.

And, as I think you say here ...

> Note that a standard recurrent NEAT implementation can achieve the
> first case all on its own, whoever, with a single recurrent link from
> a neuron's output back to its input.

... those variable time delays can indeed also be modeled by recurrent 
links.

Thanks,
Steve
